questions.question: What is the empirical formula of CAU-17?
What technique was used to confirm the unit cell parameters of CAU-17?
What was the motivation behind the synthesis of CAU-17?
questions.answer: The synthesis experiments of CAU-17 were inspired by previous reports on bismuth carboxylates and the prospect of discovering novel crystalline structures that form under short synthesis conditions.

questions.question: Is the crystal structure of CAU-17 affected by twinning?
questions.answer: Yes, the crystal structure determination of CAU-17 was impeded by the presence of twinning in all examined crystals.

questions.question: What was the result of applying a twin matrix during the refinement of CAU-17's crystal structure?
questions.answer: Upon applying the twin law, the positions of all nine BTC3- anions and nine coordinated water molecules were immediately determined in the first subsequent difference Fourier map.

questions.question: What does the thermogravimetric analysis of CAU-17 reveal about its composition?
questions.answer: The thermogravimetric analysis reveals the loss of three water molecules and one solvent methanol molecule per Bi3+ cation, indicating the presence of disordered guest species in the pores.

questions.question: How does the handedness of helical rods in CAU-17 affect its crystal structure?
questions.answer: The handedness of helical rods in CAU-17 leads to an apparent smaller unit cell when viewed from the ab-plane due to the indistinguishability of left and right-handed helices from this perspective.

questions.question: What challenges were encountered during the collection of single-crystal X-ray diffraction data for CAU-17?
questions.answer: Significant beam damage to the crystal occurred throughout data acquisition, affecting the quality of the collected data.

questions.question: What does the presence of a 2-fold twin operation in CAU-17 indicate about its crystallography?
questions.answer: The presence of a 2-fold twin operation suggests that CAU-17 exhibits merohedral twinning, complicating its structure determination.

questions.question: What was the role of methanol in the synthesis of CAU-17?
questions.answer: Methanol was used as a solvent in the solvothermal synthesis of CAU-17, inspired by previous findings that certain Bi-MOFs form under short reaction times in methanol.
